CDFglobalAttributes.Project: STSP Cluster>Solar Terrestrial Science Programmes, Cluster
CDFglobalAttributes.TEXT:
Research with Adaptive Particle Imaging Detectors (RAPID)
The RAPID spectrometer for the Cluster mission is an
advanced particle detector for the analysis of suprathermal
plasma distributions in the energy range from 39-400 keV
for electrons, 28-1500 keV (4000 keV) for hydrogen,
and 10 keV/nuc - 1500 keV (4000 keV) for heavier ions.
CDFglobalAttributes.MISSION_DESCRIPTION:
The aim of the Cluster mission is to study small-scale structures of the magnetosphere 
and its environment in three dimensions. To achieve this, Cluster is constituted of four 
identical spacecraft that will flight in a tetrahedral configuration. The separation distances 
between the spacecraft will be varied between ~3 km and 67 000 km, according to the 
key scientific regions.
CDFglobalAttributes.MISSION_REFERENCES: The Cluster and Phoenix Missions>Cluster project and instrument teams>Space Sci. Rev. 79, Nos. 1-2, 1997

 - 2000-07-24T00:00Z/2000-07-24T04:00Z :  ASPOC+CIS cover opening
 - 2000-08-23T12:30Z/2000-08-23T17:30Z :  FGM Switch-on + tests
 - 2000-08-25T01:41Z/2000-08-25T02:41Z :  WEC First full WEC on (A.4)
 - 2000-09-05T17:39Z/2000-09-05T18:39Z :  WEC Deploy booms 3 & 4 and  to 15 m (B.3)
 - 2000-09-05T18:39Z/2000-09-05T19:39Z :  WEC Deploy booms 1 & 2 from 1.3 m to 15 m (B.4)
 - 2000-09-05T19:39Z/2000-09-05T20:19Z :  WEC Spin up satellite to 22 rpm + sphere release (B.5)
 - 2000-09-12T10:15Z/2000-09-12T12:52Z :  WEC Deploy booms 3 & 4  from 15 m to 35 m (C.2)
 - 2000-09-12T11:15Z/2000-09-12T12:22Z :  WEC Deploy booms 1 & 2  from 15 m to 20 m (C.3)
 - 2000-09-18T20:15Z/2000-09-18T20:50Z :  WEC Deploy booms 3 & 4 from 35 m to 43 m (D.2)
 - 2000-10-04T16:51Z/2000-10-04T18:01Z :  WEC Deploy booms 1 & 2 from 20 m to 43 m (E.2)
 - 2000-12-06T11:00Z/2000-12-20T18:30Z :  Interferences + Intercalibration (6 orbits)/ JSOC OBRQ

CDFglobalAttributes.EXPERIMENT_DESCRIPTION:
Research with Adaptive Particle Imaging Detectors (RAPID)
The RAPID spectrometer for the Cluster mission is an
advanced particle detector for the analysis of suprathermal
plasma distributions in the energy range from 39-400 keV
for electrons, 28-1500 keV (4000 keV) for hydrogen,
and 10 keV/nuc - 1500 keV (4000 keV) for heavier ions.

CDFglobalAttributes.INSTRUMENT_DESCRIPTION:
The RAPID spectrometer on Cluster-2 (Salsa)
of the Cluster Mission to the Earth's Magnetosphere.
CDFglobalAttributes.INSTRUMENT_CAVEATS:
The middle ion detector head failed early in the Mission.
Since about 2007, the efficiencies of the electron detectors have
 steadily decayed, the effect being strongest for those perpendicular
 to the spin axis (so-called donut effect). Correction factors are being
 applied as best as can be determined, but must be viewed with caution.
The electron spectrometer failed on March 26, 2015;
 a partial recovery (3 of 9 detectors) is possible from June 12, 2015.
*C2_CQ_RAP_CAVEATS
CDFglobalAttributes.Acknowledgement:
Please acknowledge the instrument team and
the ESA Cluster Science Archive when using these data
CDFglobalAttributes.DATASET_DESCRIPTION:
This dataset contains differential fluxes of Protons
from 8 energy channels, omnidirectional
observed by the IIMS detector heads of the RAPID instrument onboard Cluster SC2

VarAttributes.CATDESC: Standard Deviation of Proton Differential Flux
